entry.title: YouTube TV update will reportedly let you watch four channels at once
entry.summary:
YouTube TV‚Äôs interface as of February 2021. | Image: Google
YouTube TV, Google‚Äôs take on cable TV, could soon let viewers watch up to four live streams simultaneously in a new feature called ‚ÄúMosaic Mode‚Äù reports Protocol. That‚Äôs according to a non-public presentation Google gave to its smart TV hardware partners, in which the search giant also discussed optimizations coming for YouTube Shorts on the big screen, as well as new YouTube Music functionality. Mosaic Mode brings to mind a similar feature that was available with Sony‚Äôs now-defunct PlayStation Vue service. Although it was announced in a presentation for Google TV and Android TV hardware manufacturers, Protocol notes that the feature is likely to eventually arrive on non-Android smart TVs from Samsung and LG given that Google likes to... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: Timezone Shenanigans in Swift
entry.summary:
And how they can drive you crazy
There comes a time when it is inevitable to work with Calendar. Sometimes it is easy, but be aware, it can be very tricky üòÖ So let's have some fun with it üëç Assume you have to compare two different Date values. let date1 = Date(timeIntervalSince1970: 0) // 1970-01-01 00:00:00 let date2 = Date(timeIntervalSince1970: 60 * 60 * 24) // 1970-01-02 00:00:00
func compareDates(date1: Date, date2: Date){ switch date1 { case date2: print("date1 and date2 represent the same point in time") case ...date2: print("date1 is earlier in time than date2") case date2...: print("date1 is later in time than date2") default: return } } compareDates(date1: date1, date2: date2)
As we would assume, we get as result "da‚Ä¶

entry.title: CloudScape Design with NextJS
entry.summary: As of July 19th, 2022 Amazon Web Services released their Design System as open-source along with a library of React components that implement the design system. This blog post is a quick overview of the design system and how it can be used with NextJS. Cloudscape Design System is an open source solution for building intuitive, engaging, and inclusive user experiences at scale. Cloudscape consists of an extensive set of guidelines to create web applications, along with the design resources and front-end components to streamline implementation. You can read more about Cloudscape here. It's a beautiful design system and offers a lot in terms of component functionality out of the box. I would highly encourage everyone to try it out. For NextJS users, you can install Cloudscape by running the f‚Ä¶

entry.title: Javascript Tagalog - String trimStart Method
entry.summary:
Disclaimer: This is a Blog i made with the initial intention of reinforcing my knowledge in JS. I just thought sharing my blogs might be helpful for someone since they are written in tagalog/taglish. Incase of Misinformation I won't be responsible for it and you can comment on the blog to address the mistake or email me. I'm always trying my best to be as accurate as possible. take a look at other resources just to be sure. Ano ngaba ang trimStart method sa Javascript? Spaces like '\n' and '\t' included sila sa trimming btw Pano gamitin: const x = " hello "; console.log( x.length ) //
//Return Value console.log( x.trimStart() ) // hello console.log( x.trimStart().length ) // 9
bumaba yung length ng na trim, kasi nga nawala yung mga spaces sa unahan :) ehehe. // Di naapektuhan yung original string console.log( x ) // hello console.log( x.length ) // 13
baka oversimplified,inacurrate information nasulat ko so here's a better in depth documentation (english) MDN Documentation - trimStart method More tagalog Javascript Learning Resources: https://javascript-in-tagalog.netlify.app

entry.title: Why is Software Maintenance Difficult and Necessary?
entry.summary: Why is software maintenance difficult? Additionally, software maintenance is an essential part of keeping systems running smoothly. If you do not maintain your software, it may malfunction or even crash. Because it appears to be simple, software maintenance is frequently overlooked. After all, it's just a matter of updating the code from time to time. However, maintaining software necessitates far more than simply changing the code. Software maintenance is complex for a mixture of explanations. In this article, we'll look at some of the factors that contribute to the difficulty of software maintenance. Then we'll look at methods to enhance it. The main reason is that software developers are usually preoccupied with new features. As a result, they may not always pay attention to existing bu‚Ä¶

entry.title: Microsoft might finally simplify its Windows 11 update names
entry.summary:
Photo by Becca Farsace / The Verge
Microsoft could be preparing to name its next big OS update as the ‚ÄúWindows 11 2022 Update.‚Äù References to this naming have appeared in near-final versions of the next big Windows 11 release, currently named 22H2. Twitter user XenoPanther spotted the Windows 11 2022 Update naming in the Get Started app that appears when you setup a new PC. The naming could simply be a placeholder, or it could indicate Microsoft is finally simplifying its often confusing update names for Windows. We‚Äôve seen a variety of names over the years, including the Creators Update naming for a big Windows 10 update, more mundane naming like the Windows 10 May 2021 Update, and more recently the Windows 10 21H2 moniker. Microsoft had considered naming its updates... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: Instagram is prototyping a BeReal murder clone
entry.summary:
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
Meta has confirmed that it‚Äôs internally prototyping a new Instagram feature that‚Äôs suspiciously similar to BeReal, the social media app that‚Äôs recently exploded in popularity. The so-called ‚ÄúIG Candid‚Äù feature discovered by leaker Alessandro Paluzzi mirrors BeReal by prompting the user to share an authentic photo at a random time each day. My colleague Casey Newton has taken to calling these imitators ‚Äúmurder clones,‚Äù because of how they appear designed to neutralize upstarts by imitating their killer features. Paluzzi posted a screenshot with Instagram‚Äôs description of how the feature could work. ‚ÄúAdd other‚Äôs IG Candid to your story tray. And everyday at a different time, get a notification to capture and share a Photo in 2 Minutes,‚Äù... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: Self Hosted Security
entry.summary: There is a lot of important knowledge about securing Unix machines that none seems to care about any more. In this Cloud world, where every service just falls out of the sky straight into our arms, ready for consumption, we don't seem to need a lot of it anymore. But maybe it's not really the case. Someone in the remote castles of $bigcloudprovider must still know about how to implement firewalls, how to elastically scale message queues and databases. The spells of Consul, Eventual Consistency, Gossip protocols and Load Balancing are relegated more and more in the rooms of those big providers, until the point they have sucked in the entire world. By then, nothing will be left. You will be only able to buy Scalable Services that the seller says it is secure, apart that you are not able to say whether it is for real: https://kevwe.com/weekly/202234

entry.title: SASS IT! The Beginner's Guide to SASS
entry.summary:
Are CSS Preprocessors necessary? My answer is yes and also no. You may not need a preprocessor for small web projects or applications. For bigger projects with complex user interfaces, preprocess helps a lot as maintenance & readability of CSS code get harder as the project gets bigger.
For those who don't know what preprocessors are, they‚Äôre all fantastic tools to maintain your CSS, especially when working with large codebases. "A CSS preprocessor is a program that lets you generate CSS from the preprocessor‚Äôs own unique syntax. There are many CSS preprocessors to choose from, however, most CSS preprocessors will add some features that don‚Äôt exist in pure CSS, such as mixin, nesting selector, inheritance selector, and so on. These features make the CSS structure more readable and easier ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Passwordless.id - first screenshots
entry.summary:
Introduction
So, first things first, I chose a domain name, yay! It's https://passwordless.id ...now "id" is quite an unusual ending (it's actually for Indonesia), but I thought it would fit well as a shortening of "identity" since that is what this upcoming app is about. What is this about? It's about providing a smoother and safer authentication to the masses. How? Using your fingerprint or face to register/login for instance. And of course, it's not sent to the server! If you want to try out and learn more about it, just go to the website, there is a really basic demo and explanations. What I'm developing right now is a "public service" allowing anyone to register/login passwordlessly. It's really easy and more secure (for an in-depth explanation, check the website). Roughly speaking,‚Ä¶

entry.title: How I migrated to NetworkManager keyfiles for configuration
entry.summary:
How I migrated to NetworkManager keyfiles for configuration David Both Tue, 08/23/2022 - 03:00
Register or Login to like Register or Login to like NetworkManager was introduced in 2004 to make network configuration more flexible and dynamic. The old SystemV startup shell scripts, of which the interface configuration files were a part, were incapable of handling WiFi, wired, VPNs, broadband modems, and more‚Äîor at least incapable of doing it quickly or efficiently. In a series of articles, I've written about why I'm a fan of NetworkManager and how I've used it. In part 1, I looked at what NetworkManager does and some of the tools it provides for viewing network connections and devices. In that article, I mentioned that NetworkManager does not need interface configuration files for most‚Ä¶

entry.title: WatchData ‚Äî API service for Web3
entry.summary:
What is WatchData? It is a platform for blockchain developers and researchers that makes it easier to build and run blockchain applications and process blockchain data.
How does it help? ‚úÖ WatchData eliminates a need to run your own node, allowing to call most of the JSON-RPC methods via our API the same way as it was your own node. ‚úÖ Saves costs on development and associated expenses by scaling your infrastructure. ‚úÖ Supports innovative blockchains (and we constantly add more!) ‚úÖ Offers live blockchain data 24/7.
WatchData products include: ‚õì Blockchain Node API ‚Äî raw data, the information transcribed into applicable and useful data needed for conducting thorough analysis and research. üóÉ Powered API ‚Äî a more structured format of data, which we extract from raw blockchain, process throu‚Ä¶

entry.title: Engineer admits he stole trade secrets while working on the Apple Car
entry.summary:
He could face up to 10 years in prison. | Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
Xiaolang Zhang has pled guilty to stealing trade secrets from Apple, where he worked on a self-driving car project from 2015 to 2018 (via CNBC). When he quit his job at Apple, he told his supervisor that he was going to work for Guangzhou Xiaopeng Motors Technology, a Chinese EV startup also known as Xpeng. During an investigation, which you can read more about here, Apple determined that he had transferred around 24GB of ‚Äúhighly problematic‚Äù data to his wife‚Äôs laptop via AirDrop, and had also taken circuit boards and a server from the company‚Äôs autonomous vehicle lab.
The terms of Zhang‚Äôs plea agreement aren‚Äôt publicly available, but according to a court document uploaded by CNBC (pdf), Zhang pled guilty to the single theft of trade... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: Amazon is fixing the AC at a warehouse where a worker died on Prime Day
entry.summary:
An investigation into the incident is ongoing. | Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
Amazon is reportedly installing new air conditioning equipment and additional fans at its EWR9 warehouse in New Jersey, according to a report by NBC News. This comes after Reynaldo Mota Frias, a worker at the facility, died on July 13th, during the Prime Day rush, on a day when temperatures rose to 92 degrees. Amazon reportedly blames Frias‚Äô death on ‚Äúa personal medical condition‚Äù and denies reports that he told managers he was feeling unwell. An investigation by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (or OSHA) is listed as ongoing. Another employee at EWR9 told NBC that the warehouse gets hot, even in areas that have fans. The company has faced criticism from workers before about how it handles workloads during the i... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: HBO calls House of the Dragon its biggest premiere ever, with nearly 10 million US viewers
entry.summary:
House of the Dragon | Image: HBO
Despite glitches for some people trying to watch via Fire TV Sticks, HBO announced that the first episode of its Game of Thrones spinoff House of the Dragon recorded the network‚Äôs biggest premiere of all time, recording 9.986 million viewers across linear and HBO Max streaming on Sunday night in the US alone. The original Game of Thrones series closed out its run with 13.7 million live viewers on linear channels for the finale in 2019, clocking over 19 million views with the addition of streaming and video-on-demand numbers. According to HBO, ahead of the Dragon premiere, interest in the original series ‚Äî with the entire series now available for streaming in 4K on HBO Max ‚Äî spiked, drawing a weekly average in streaming for August that... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: Sony says the PlayStation VR2 is coming in early 2023
entry.summary:
The PlayStation VR2 | Image: Sony
Sony‚Äôs PlayStation VR2 headset is coming in ‚Äúearly 2023,‚Äù according to posts the company made on Twitter and Instagram. Sony has been trickling information out about the upcoming headset over the past several months, and now we have at least a timeframe for when we can expect to get our hands on the hardware. While the company released details of the headset‚Äôs design earlier this year, it still hasn‚Äôt announced a price. It is, however, promising a lot for the PlayStation VR2 ‚Äî it‚Äôll feature displays that add up to 4K resolution and can run at 90 or 120Hz, have a 110-degree field of view, and use foveated rendering, which renders certain parts of the image as sharper than others to make things easier for the computer (or, in this case,... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: The Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic remake has a new developer
entry.summary:
Saber Interactive had been helping out, and now it‚Äôs reportedly taking over. | Image: Sony
Embracer Group is moving development on the upcoming Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic (KOTOR) remake for PS5 and PC from Aspyr Media to a Saber Interactive studio in Eastern Europe, according to Bloomberg. The game, announced last September in a short trailer during a Sony showcase, was originally being made by Aspyr, which is known for its ports of KOTOR and KOTOR II. But development on the remake was paused after a demo was shown to Lucasfilm and Sony, Bloomberg reported in July. Saber had been helping with development on the remake, but a cryptic statement in Embracer‚Äôs earnings report last week seemed to suggest that Saber could be officially taking over. ‚ÄúOne of the Group‚Äôs AAA projects has transitioned to another studio... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: Apple‚Äôs M2-powered 14- and 16-inch MacBook Pros could arrive early next year
entry.summary:
Photo by Becca Farsace / The Verge
We may need to wait longer for the 3nm MacBook than we‚Äôd previously hoped. New 14-inch and 16-inch MacBook Pros are on the horizon, according to a new prediction from analyst Ming-Chi Kuo, but they‚Äôre unlikely to be the 3nm process. Refreshes of the excellent professional MacBooks ‚Äúwill enter mass production‚Äù in Q4 of 2022, Kuo tweeted this morning. Kuo‚Äôs intel indicates that they ‚Äúmay still adopt the 5nm advanced node,‚Äù which is the same process node that the recent M2 MacBook Air and MacBook Pro models use. That would, if true, mean that Apple‚Äôs first 3nm MacBook chips, also rumored to be entering production later this year, will not debut in these machines. New 14" and 16" MacBook Pro with new processors will enter mass production... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: Intel needs 7,000 workers to build its $20 billion chip plant in Ohio
entry.summary:
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
Intel is building what it claims is the ‚Äúlargest silicon manufacturing location on the planet‚Äù in Ohio, and it‚Äôs going to need 7,000 workers to construct it, according to a report from the Associated Press. However, a labor shortage affecting the construction industry could make it hard to recruit the workers it needs for the $20 billion job, and competition for workers could slow the pace of homebuilding in the area which is needed to support the growing workforce that Intel‚Äôs plant is supposed to attract. Intel first announced the Ohio project in January of this year and is on track to begin construction in late 2022. Once finished, the 1,000-acre site will house two factories, or fabs, and employ at least 3,000 people. But it has... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: Unstruk Data Portal ‚Äî Search, visualize and analyze spatial and unstructured data
entry.summary:
Welcome page, and the videos walk you through the power of the data portal.
What we call the 'geo-enabled business' is a company who creates and manages data about their slice of the real world - for example, commercial real estateüè£, agriculture and farmingüêñ, manufacturing plantsüè≠, or construction projectsüî®.
Companies like this are capturing more and more data every day: drone photos, mobile phone videos üì±, thermal cameras üì∑, geospatial shape files, 3D and pointclouds from photogrammetry, Zoom recordingsüéôabout a client project, or simply Office documents and PDFs.
Via machine learning, we extract 'observations' of people üë™, places ‚õ∫ üåÅ ‚õ™ and things üöÅüöäüöú in your files - into your personal knowledge graph. From this data in the knowledge graph, you can search, filter, view, analyze on a map or over time - or send alerts to Slack, send daily email summaries, or even connect via webhook to your own APIs.
Also, you can plugin machine learning APIs to extract even more information - via computer vision, text analysis or audio transcription. We ship with some of the leading APIs out of the box (AssemblyAI, Roboflow, Primer), but you can also bring ML models that you, your company or a partner have built.
We have tons more features coming later this year, like ESRI ArcGIS integration, photogrammetry support, more data feeds and enrichments, and publishing out to other databases and platforms.
When you signup for a free 14 day trial, you'll get 100GB of cloud storage and access to all our current features.
Try it out today at https://portal.unstruk.ai, and we look forward to hearing what you think!
Thanks, Kirk
Founder, CEO Unstruk Data ‚Äù
Discussion | Link

entry.title: massCode 3.0 ‚Äî A free and open source code snippet manager for developers
entry.summary:
What it is and why
massCode is a snippet manager for developers that helps you conveniently organize pieces of code and have quick access to them. Multilevel folders and tags are used for organization, and each snippet has fragments for even more granular structuring. The app supports Markdown so it can be used as a notebook if needed.
What's New
Direct support for TextMate grammars
Now massCode uses Codemirror as the basis for the editor and `.tmLanguage` as the grammar for syntax highlighting. This tandem opens the door to over 600 existing grammars. The application currently supports more than 160 grammars. In addition to `.tmLanguage`, the application supports `.tmTheme` for themes.
Real-time Render for HTML & CSS
Now you can see the result of HTML & CSS directly in the application. This is such a CodePen on minimal :)
Mermaid Diagram
Added support for Mermaid - diagramming and charting tool that renders Markdown-inspired text definitions to create and modify diagrams dynamically.
Presentation Mode
massCode allows you to make a presentation out of a sequence of snippets. It's great for classroom use, team meetings, conferences or simply reviewing notes on your own.
Screnshots
Create beautiful snippet images on different backgrounds and in different modes.
Localization
massCode is available in English, Espa√±ol, Portugu√™s (Brasil), –†—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–π, ‰∏≠Êñá (ÁÆÄ‰Ωì), ‰∏≠Êñá (ÁπÅÈ´î), ‰∏≠Êñá (ÁπÅÈ´î È¶ôÊ∏ØÁâπÂà•Ë°åÊîøÂçÄ) & Êó•Êú¨Ë™û languages. ‚Äù

entry.title: Mentoring as a power multiplier in open source
entry.summary:
Mentoring as a power multiplier in open source Josh Salomon Mon, 08/22/2022 - 03:00
5 readers like this 5 readers like this Many developers struggle with work-life balance. They are overloaded with regular tasks and frequently called upon to solve urgent customer issues. Yet many developers, like me, have ideas they want to promote if only they had time to do so. Sometimes these pet ideas do not make it through the product management feature-selection process. Other times, a developer does not have time to complete the solution end-to-end on their own, yet they know if it could somehow be implemented, the project would benefit. This is where mentoring comes in. Mentorship has many benefits: It helps the mentee's personal development, and it can improve the mentor's self-confidence an‚Ä¶

entry.title: My first impression of GNOME Console on Linux
entry.summary:
My first impression of GNOME Console on Linux Alan Formy-Duval Mon, 08/22/2022 - 03:00
3 readers like this 3 readers like this New on the GNOME desktop is their terminal emulator application simply named Console. It seems aimed at providing a no-nonsense, stable command-line environment for Linux users. Introducing GNOME Console for Linux
Image by: ‚Äã(Alan Formy-Duval, CC BY-SA 4.0) ‚Äã
The GNOME Console isn't as feature-rich as a lot of other terminals, including the previous GNOME terminal, but I like it and have been using it regularly for the past few months. I enjoy the simplicity of it. I waste time in other terminal emulators configuring fonts, colors, and profiles. Console does have some options and nice integration with the GNOME desktop. entry.title: Rye Store Builder ‚Äî Earn money by sharing your favorite products
entry.summary:
Rye Store Builder
We‚Äôre excited to launch one of the first apps built on the Rye Protocol, the Rye Store Builder. The Rye Store Builder is a free tool that lets anyone earn in seconds by letting anyone easily create their own custom store with the products they love.
The Rye Store Builder is useful for anyone ‚Äî from a way to share the products you use, to influencers who want to create another income source with affiliate commissions without having to worry about getting brand deals or inventory.
How it works
Creating a store takes seconds. To get started:
1. Sign up on our website. 2. Customize your store by adding your details, add products by inputting the product URL of any Amazon or Shopify product 3. Share your custom store URL with your followers
Features
üõçÔ∏è Add products in seconds ü§ë Earn commissions on over 300 million products Amazon and Shopify [coming soon] products üñºÔ∏è Reward your shoppers with NFTs [coming soon] ‚Ñ¢Ô∏è Customize your store with captions üîó Choose your store name
Example Stores
My store: https://arjun.rye.store Justin Kan‚Äôs store: https://justin.rye.store Jamie Quint's store: https://jamie.rye.store
Free and Open Source
The Rye Store Builder is **not for profit.** We‚Äôve open sourced our code under an MIT license, and allowing anyone to clone the code and launch their own store builder. We think that the store builder is just one example of an unlimited amount of new shopping experiences that can be built with the Rye Protocol. ‚Äù

entry.title: UpSavvy ‚Äî Helping K-12 school districts solve digital citizenship
entry.summary:
Why is digital citizenship important to teach? Some stats from the USA: - 93% of young people aged 8-18 owned a smartphone in 2021 - 37% of young people between the ages of 12 and 17 have been cyberbullied - Teens who spend 5 or more hours online a day are 71% more likely than those who spend only 1 hour a day to have at least one suicide risk factor - 89% of sexual advances directed at young people occur through instant messaging & chatroom - 80% of middle schoolers believed that an advertisement labeled as sponsored content was actually a news story - 60% of educational organizations experienced phishing attacks in 2020 - Ransomware attacks on US schools and colleges cost $3.5 billion in 2021
Through research and discussions with K-12 school districts, we learned that digital citizenship is a priority, but districts lack the tools to deliver up-to-date content at scale and measure results. Teachers also have very limited amounts of time to effectively incorporate digital citizenship lessons into their curriculum. We also learned that students are becoming accustomed to learning through short form video content.
Why UpSavvy works: - Takes students less than 5 minutes a month to learn digital citizenship. - Interactive content with over 200 bite size videos, quizzes & simulations. - Empowers teachers with resources while minimizing their time investment. - Enhances the classroom experience without sacrificing learning time. - Integrates directly with school district rostering & LMS systems including Clever, Classlink, Google & Microsoft - Curriculum covers topics: Privacy & Security, Digital Well-Being, Cyberbullying, Digital Footprint, Media Literacy, Technology Essentials, Online Relationships & Safety, Digital Commerce, Digital Finance
As parents and technology experts, our mission is to help K-12 students make better decisions online. Try some free lessons by signing up on our website, we appreciate your feedback. ‚Äù
Discussion | Link

entry.summary:
What's your favorite screenshot tool on Linux? AmyJune Hineline Sat, 08/20/2022 - 03:00
4 readers like this 4 readers like this As the saying goes, a picture is worth a thousand words, and while that's not always the case with terminal commands and code, it still holds true for the graphical desktop. Screenshots capture precisely what's on your screen. I love taking them to have a record of who attends meetings, so I don't have to write it down at the moment. Or to capture a bug when doing UI testing. We all take them for different reasons, though, and there are more ways to take a screenshot than you might at first think. entry.title: My journey with Kubernetes
entry.summary:
My journey with Kubernetes Mike Dame Fri, 08/19/2022 - 03:00
1 reader likes this 1 reader likes this Recently, I published my first book, The Kubernetes Operator Framework Book from Packt Publishing. Writing a book has always been a personal goal of mine, and so it seems fitting that I was able to check that off by writing about one of my favorite topics: Kubernetes. My journey with Kubernetes began in 2016, as a software engineer for Red Hat OpenShift. There, I had the opportunity to work with (and learn from) some of the smartest folks in the open source community. I learned first-hand some of the best practices for Kubernetes development as they were applied to broad enterprise use cases. And as I watched the development of OpenShift 4 take shape, I got to witness the functionalit‚Ä¶

entry.title: 5 note-taking apps for Linux
entry.summary:
5 note-taking apps for Linux Don Watkins Fri, 08/19/2022 - 03:00
6 readers like this 6 readers like this Notes are part of any writer's life. Most of my articles begin in a note-taking application and that‚Äôs usually Joplin for me. There are a large number of note-taking apps for Linux and you may use something other than my favorite. A recent blog article reminded me of a half dozen of them, so I assembled a list of my favorites. Joplin
Image by: (Opensource.com, CC BY-SA 4.0) Joplin is available on Linux, Windows, macOS, Android, and iOS. I like Joplin because it automatically saves whatever you add to it. Notes can be uploaded to NextCloud, OwnCloud, Joplin Cloud, and even closed source services like OneDrive, Dropbox, or any WebDav applications. Joplin supports en‚Ä¶

entry.title: Open source runs on non-code contributions
entry.summary:
Open source runs on non-code contributions John E. Picozzi Thu, 08/18/2022 - 03:00
2 readers like this 2 readers like this At this year's DrupalCon North America, EPAM Solution Architect John Picozzi presented a talk about the importance of non-code contribution. He talked about how everyone can get involved and why he believes this is an important topic. This article is a text adaptation of John's talk; find a link below to a video recording of the complete presentation at DrupalCon. What is non-code contribution? I asked Google this question and got the following answer: "Any contribution that helps an open source project that does not involve writing code." Thanks, Google, but I already figured that out. If you asked me to dig deeper, I'd say it's about providing your time, skills‚Ä¶

entry.title: Measure latency for embedded systems with this open source tool
entry.summary:
Measure latency for embedded systems with this open source tool Nicolas Rabault Wed, 08/17/2022 - 03:00
3 readers like this 3 readers like this When it comes to time synchronization for embedded systems in a distributed architecture, there are "soft" use cases (typical, everyday devices) and complex, or "hard," use cases (car brake systems, aerospace). It's easy to see that a hard use case has unique requirements and a low tolerance for latency. To put it another way, hard use cases have hard, real-time constraints. Latency is the bitter enemy of real-time computation. Latency, in the context of a critical real-time application, is the time between data generation and data reception. The reality is that when there is an interconnected network of several systems, there's latency. [ Re‚Ä¶

entry.title: 4 common issues with implementing Agile and how to address them
entry.summary:
4 common issues with implementing Agile and how to address them Kelsea Zhang Wed, 08/17/2022 - 03:00
3 readers like this 3 readers like this While working on the open source ZenTao project, I get constant feedback that getting Agile up and running is a big task in many organizations. As with any new process, you will run into issues, and many of them will feel unique to your organization. While context is important, there's a certain amount of abstraction possible after you've coached enough teams. This article covers the four most common issues I've encountered. While your Agile coach should analyze any actual problems in the context of your organization, knowing these general issues can help better prepare you and your teams for the transitional process. entry.title: My practical advice for new programmers
entry.summary:
My practical advice for new programmers Sachin Samal Tue, 08/16/2022 - 03:00
5 readers like this 5 readers like this Have you ever been stuck or gone blank trying to solve a problem related to something that you just learned from YouTube or Google tutorials? You seem to understand every line of the code, but without the tutorial, you find yourself in a difficult position. If you have looked at problem-solving in HackerRank or LeetCode, you can relate to how an aspiring programmer feels seeing those challenges for the first time. Everything seems out of the box! Being unable to apply what you learned from a tutorial might make you doubt your knowledge and abilities as you begin to understand the basics of the programming language you're learning. entry.title: Colonist.io ‚Äî Play competitive Settlers of Catan online
entry.summary:
@demirbyilmaz.
We started working on Colonist in 2018 because we wanted to play Catan with our family. None of the online versions were really playable, so, like any programmer would have done, we built our own! Since then, we have worked tirelessly to create the best gameplay experience possible. Over time, we have grown and improved our player experience, and at this point, it is clear that Colonist is ready to become a staple in online strategy gaming.
This is why we are proud to officially announce Ranked Mode and a Leaderboard system for Colonist! Competing in Ranked is easy:
1. Navigate to https://colonist.io/ and select either ‚ÄúRanked 4P‚Äù or ‚ÄúRanked 1v1‚Äù 2. Play in 10 placement games to establish your Matchmaking Ranking (MMR) 3. After your placement games, you will be placed in matches against players with similar MMR. Fight to move your way up the leaderboard!
In the future, we plan to have prizes for top finishers and create a ladder-like league with divisions. In the meantime, we crave feedback and would love to hear about all of your experiences playing on our site. Please let us know what you think in the comments.
May your roads be long and your armies large, Goktug Yilmaz ‚Äù
Discussion | Link
